title: Rocket Lab launches classified mission for National Reconnaissance Office
summary: A Rocket Lab Electron rocket launched a National Reconnaissance Office mission Aug. 4 at 1:00 a.m. Eastern. The NROL-199 mission lifted off from the company’s Launch Complex-1 at Mahia Peninsula, New Zealand.

title: First SLS launch remains on schedule for late August
summary: Preparations for the first flight of the Space Launch System remain on track for a liftoff as soon as Aug. 29, NASA officials said Aug. 3.

title: With solar arrays now operational, Lucy’s got some shimmering to do
summary: We've still got to wait three years before the first asteroid flyby.

title: Lockheed invests in Xona’s GPS-alternative constellation
summary: Startup Xona Space Systems has raised around $15 million for its proposed navigation constellation, including funds from GPS satellite maker Lockheed Martin’s venture capital arm.

title: SpaceX working to improve fairing recovery for continued success
summary: After a year of solid success with Falcon 9 fairing recovery and reuse, SpaceX has once again started tinkering with the recovery operation.
